channel.title: Logistic on t-student
channel.description: Recent content in Logistic on t-student

item.title: Rationalising Odds Ratios Results
item.description: You have just fitted a logistic regression model in R using glm. Your results suggest that treatment group membership (active versus placebo) is strongly associated with the probability of being able to endure open-plan offices, micro-management and your fellow comrades 5 days a week. For the sake of realism, let’s assume the active treatment is a (very) powerful anti-psychotic and that it has been randomised to a simple random sample of employees.
